  • Deuteronomy 34
1 And it shall be, when thou art come in unto the land which the Domina thy God giveth thee for an inheritance, and dost possess it, and dwell therein; 2 that thou shalt take of the first of all the fruit of the ground, which thou shalt bring in from thy land that the Domina thy God giveth thee; and thou shalt put it in a basket and shalt go unto the place which the Domina thy God shall choose to cause Her name to dwell there. 3 And thou shalt come unto the priestess that shall be in those days, and say unto her: 'I profess this day unto the Domina thy God, that I am come unto the land which the Domina swore unto our mothers to give us.' 4 And the priestess shall take the basket out of thy hand, and set it down before the altar of the Domina thy God. 5 And thou shalt speak and say before the Domina thy God: 'A wandering Aramean was my mother, and she went down into Egypt, and sojourned there, few in number; and she became there a nation, great, mighty, and populous. 6 And the Egyptians dealt ill with us, and afflicted us, and laid upon us hard bondage. 7 And we cried unto the Domina, the God of our mothers, and the Domina heard our voice, and saw our affliction, and our toil, and our oppression. 8 And the Domina brought us forth out of Egypt with a mighty hand, and with an outstretched arm, and with great terribleness, and with signs, and with wonders. 9 And She hath brought us into this place, and hath given us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.
10 And now, behold, I have brought the first of the fruit of the land, which Thou, O Domina, hast given me.' And thou shalt set it down before the Domina thy God, and worship before the Domina thy God. 11 And thou shalt rejoice in all the good which the Domina thy God hath given unto thee, and unto thy house, thou, and the Levite, and the stranger that is in the midst of thee.   12 When thou hast made an end of tithing all the tithe of thine increase in the third year, which is the year of tithing, and hast given it unto the Levite, to the stranger, to the fatherless, and to the widower, that they may eat within thy gates, and be satisfied, 13 then thou shalt say before the Domina thy God: 'I have put away the hallowed things out of my house, and also have given them unto the Levite, and unto the stranger, to the fatherless, and to the widower, according to all Thy commandment which Thou hast commanded me; I have not transgressed any of Thy commandments, neither have I forgotten them. 14 I have not eaten thereof in my mourning, neither have I put away thereof, being unclean, nor given thereof for the dead; I have hearkened to the voice of the Domina my God, I have done according to all that Thou hast commanded me. 15 Look forth from Thy holy habitation, from heaven, and bless Thy people Israel, and the land which Thou hast given us, as Thou didst swear unto our mothers, a land flowing with milk and honey.'   16 This day the Domina thy God commandeth thee to do these statutes and ordinances; thou shalt therefore observe and do them with all thy heart, and with all thy soul. 17 Thou hast avouched the Domina this day to be thy God, and that thou wouldest walk in Her ways, and keep Her statutes, and Her commandments, and Her ordinances, and hearken unto Her voice. 18 And the Domina hath avouched thee this day to be Her own treasure, as She hath promised thee, and that thou shouldest keep all Her commandments;
